isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - RELAY VALVE (BENDIX R-12 AND R-14) - CLEAN AND INSPECT

step1.para: Wash all metal parts in mineral spirits and dry them thoroughly.

note.para: When rebuilding, all springs and all rubber parts should be replaced.

step1.para: Inspect all metal parts for deterioration and wear, as evidenced by scratches, scoring and corrosion.
Inspect the exhaust valve seat on the relay piston for nicks and scratches which could cause excessive leakage.
Inspect the inlet valve seat in the body for scratches and nicks, which could cause excessive leakage.
Inspect the exhaust seat of the quick release diaphragm in the R-14 cover and make sure all internal passages in this area are open, clean, and free of nicks and scratches.
Replace all parts considered serviceable during these inspections and all springs and rubber parts.
